document_data.name: Gnats
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|19}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Gnats''''' was a personal [[cantrip]] that neophyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It summoned a swarm of [[wikipedia:gnat|gnats]] to bother and distract a nearby creature.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip conjured a small swarm of tiny flying insects that occupied a volume of {{SI|1|cu ft|c|long=yes}}. It appeared at a spot within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}}The original description of this spell in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the 1{{st}}-edition nomenclature 1", meaning {{SI|10|ft}} indoors and {{SI|10|yd}} outdoors. This was simplified to the shorter range in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. and immediately formed a cloud around the head of the creature nearest to the summoning point. If the target did not resist the magic of this spell, they were distracted by the gnats for a few seconds before the bugs flew off. If the target successfully resisted, then they were essentially unaffected.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster pointed at the target while making a high-pitched sound, like the buzzing of tiny wings close to one's ear, using the tongue and upper palate.
